_header: Whoso hath a wife and list for to swyve
_description: Translation of ‘Qui provam habet conjugem qui odit laborare…’ — four monorhyming lines

Leicester4.Transcription:
Woys hat a wyf and leȝt fort to suyncLige longe in hyr bed and
                    lef fort drincScho were betir in ȝe se fer from ȝe brincIn a
                    botymles bot to lern fort sinc
Leicester4.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas. 
             “Anecdota Literaria: Scraps in English and Latin From A Manuscript of
                the Fourteenth Century, in the Library of the Corporation of Leicester.” 
             Retrospective Review
         1 (Aug., 1853): 419: 419.
